dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 5760 IH: Trade Authority Protection Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Kind (for himself, Mr. Norman, Mr. Meeks, and Mr. Dent) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Rules, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To provide for congressional review of the imposition of duties and other trade measures by the executive branch, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Trade Authority Protection Act.

section.header: Review of congressionally delegated trade actions

subsection.text: Chapter 5 of title I of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2191 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Review of congressionally delegated trade actions

paragraph.text: In this section, the term congressionally delegated trade action means any of the following actions taken with respect to the importation of an article pursuant to a provision of law specified in paragraph (2):

subparagraph.text: A prohibition on importation of the article.
The imposition of or an increase in a duty applicable to the article.
The imposition or tightening of a tariff-rate quota applicable to the article.
The imposition or tightening of a quantitative restriction on the importation of the article.
The suspension, withdrawal, or prevention of the application of trade agreement concessions with respect to the article.
Any other restriction on importation of the article.

paragraph.text: The provisions of law specified in this paragraph are the following:

subparagraph.text: Section 122.
Title III.
Sections 406, 421, and 422.
Section 338 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1338).
Section 232 of the Trade Expansion Act of 1962 (19 U.S.C. 1862).
Section 103(a) of the Bipartisan Congressional Trade Priorities and Accountability Act of 2015 (19 U.S.C. 4202(a)).
The Trading with the Enemy Act (50 U.S.C. 4301 et seq.).
The International Emergency Economic Powers Act (50 U.S.C. 1701 et seq.).
Any provision of law enacted to implement a trade agreement to which the United States is a party.

paragraph.header: Exception for technical corrections to Harmonized Tariff Schedule
paragraph.text: A technical correction to the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States shall not be considered a congressionally delegated trade action for purposes of this section.

subsection.header: Effective date for congressionally delegated trade action

paragraph.text: A congressionally delegated trade action shall take effect 60 days after the date of the submission of the report required under paragraph (2) unless a joint resolution of disapproval is enacted pursuant to subsection (d).
With respect to any proposed congressionally delegated trade action, the President shall submit to Congress and to the Comptroller General of the United States a report that includes—

subparagraph.text: a description of the proposed action;
the proposed effective period for the action;
an analysis of the action, including whether the action is in the national economic interest of the United States;
an assessment of the potential effect of retaliation from trading partners affected by the action;
an analysis of the economic impacts of the action and of such retaliation; and
a list of articles that will be affected by the action by subheading number of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States.

subsection.text: Not later than 15 days after the submission of the report required by subsection (b)(1) with respect to a proposed congressionally delegated trade action, the Comptroller General shall submit to Congress a report on the proposed action that includes an assessment of the compliance of the President with the provision of law specified in subsection (a)(2) pursuant to which the action would be taken.

subsection.header: Congressional Review Act procedures for joint resolution of disapproval

paragraph.header: Application of Congressional Review Act procedures
paragraph.text: A joint resolution under this subsection shall be considered in the same manner and subject to the same procedures as a joint resolution under section 802 of title 5, United States Code (referred to as the Congressional Review Act), except that subsection (b)(2) of such section shall be applied by substituting the date of the submission of the report required under paragraph (2) for the submission or publication date under such subsection.

For purposes of this subsection, the term joint resolution means only a joint resolution of either House of Congress, the matter after the resolving clause of which is as follows: That Congress disapproves the action proposed by the President in the report submitted to Congress under section 155(b)(2) of the Trade Act of 1974 on _______, and such action shall have no force or effect., with the blank space being filled with the appropriate date.

subsection.header: Report by the United States International Trade Commission
subsection.text: Not later than 12 months after the date on which a congressionally delegated trade action enters into effect pursuant to this section, the United States International Trade Commission shall submit to the Committee on Finance of the Senate and the Committee on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives a report on the effects of the action on the United States economy, including a comprehensive assessment of the economic effects of the action on producers and consumers in the United States.
The table of contents for the Trade Act of 1974 is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 154 the following:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 155. Review of congressionally delegated trade actions.

paragraph.text: Section 122 of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2132) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), in the flush text following paragraph (3), by inserting and subject to disapproval under section 155 after Congress);
in subsection (c), in the flush text following paragraph (2), by inserting and subject to disapproval under section 155 after Congress); and
in subsection (g), by inserting and subject to disapproval under section 155 after of this section.

paragraph.text: Section 151(a) of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2191(a)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking and 153 and inserting , 153, and 155; and
in paragraph (1), by striking and 153(a) and inserting , 153(a), and 155(e).

paragraph.header: Enforcement of rights under trade agreements
paragraph.text: Title III of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2411 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in section 301—

clause.text: in subsection (a), in the flush text, by inserting to disapproval under section 155 and after subsection (c), subject; and
in subsection (b)(2), by inserting to disapproval under section 155 and after subsection (c), subject;

subparagraph.text: in section 305(a)(1), by inserting to disapproval under section 155 and after section 301, subject; and
in section 307(a)(1), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting to disapproval under section 155 and after any action, subject.

paragraph.text: Section 406 of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2436) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b), in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking With respect to and inserting Subject to disapproval under section 155, with respect to; and
in subsection (c), in the second sentence, by striking If the President and inserting Subject to disapproval under section 155, if the President.

paragraph.text: Section 421 of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2451) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by inserting and subject to disapproval under section 155 after of this section;
in subsection (i)(4)(A), by inserting , subject to disapproval under section 155, after provisional relief and;
in subsection (k)(1), by striking Within 15 days and inserting Subject to section 155, within 15 days;
by striking subsection (m) and by redesignating subsections (n) and (o) as subsections (m) and (n), respectively;
in subsection (m), as redesignated by subparagraph (D)—

clause.text: in paragraph (1), by striking subsection (m) and inserting this section; and
in paragraph (2), by inserting and subject to disapproval under section 155 after paragraph (1); and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (3) of subsection (n), as redesignated by subparagraph (D), by striking subsection (m) and inserting this section.

paragraph.header: Action in response to trade diversion
paragraph.text: Section 422(h) of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2451a(h)) is amended by striking Within 20 days and inserting Subject to disapproval under section 155, within 20 days.
Section 338 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1338) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by inserting , subject to disapproval under section 155 of the Trade Act of 1974, after by proclamation;
in subsection (b), by inserting subject to disapproval under section 155 of the Trade Act of 1974 and after hereby authorized,;
in subsection (c), by striking Any proclamation and inserting Subject to disapproval under section 155 of the Trade Act of 1974, any proclamation;
in subsection (d), by inserting subject to disapproval under section 155 of the Trade Act of 1974 and after he shall,; and
in subsection (e), by inserting subject to disapproval under section 155 of the Trade Act of 1974 and after he shall,.

paragraph.text: Section 232(c)(1)(B) of the Trade Expansion Act of 1962 (19 U.S.C. 1862(c)(1)(B)) is amended by inserting , subject to disapproval under section 155 of the Trade Act of 1974, after shall.

paragraph.header: Bipartisan Congressional Trade Priorities and Accountability Act of 2015
paragraph.text: Section 103(a) of the Bipartisan Congressional Trade Priorities and Accountability Act of 2015 (19 U.S.C. 4202(a)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(B), by inserting and disapproval under section 155 of the Trade Act of 1974 after paragraphs (2) and (3); and
in paragraph (7), by inserting and disapproval under section 155 of the Trade Act of 1974 after 3524).

paragraph.text: Section 203(a)(1)(B) of the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (50 U.S.C. 1702(a)(1)(B)) is amended by inserting (subject to section 155 of the Trade Act of 1974) after importation.
Section 11 of the Trading with the Enemy Act (50 U.S.C. 4311) is amended by striking Whenever and inserting Subject to disapproval under section 155 of the Trade Act of 1974, whenever.

subparagraph.header: North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act
subparagraph.text: Section 201 of the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act (19 U.S.C. 3331) is amended—

clause.text: in subsection (a)(1), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking may and inserting may, subject to disapproval under section 155 of the Trade Act of 1974,; and

in subsection (b)(1), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking and the consultation and layover requirements of section 103(a) and inserting , the consultation and layover requirements of section 103(a), and disapproval under section 155 of the Trade Act of 1974,.
